Elliotte Harold wrote:

>J. B. Rainsberger wrote:
>
>  
>
>>Indeed. If I violate your precondition, then I am writing defective
>>code. There are a few remedies:
>>    
>>
>
>A nice list. However, I would claim only 1-3 are remedies. 
>Documentation, including tests as documentation, are not remedies. They 
>are useful, certainly, but they should not be relied on. Much brutal 
>experience proves that:
>
>A. Programmers cannot be relied on to read documentation
>B. Programmers cannot be relied on to run tests
>  
>

So, (playing devil's advocate), we should treat them like babies?  How 
will they act when we do?

Just playing devil's advocate here for the sake of discussion.. see my 
point?
